sections.title: 2 Backg\found\t 2.1 Wikipedia\t
paragraphs: WikipediÓt is Ót free online encyclopediÓt compiled by millions of volunteers Ótll Ótround the world. Anyone on the internet cÓtn freely edit existing entries Ótnd/or creÓtte new entries to Ótdd to WikipediÓt. Owing to the size of its pÓtrticipÓtntsÓf WikipediÓt hÓts Ótchieved both high quÓtntity Ótnd quÓtlity. In fÓtctÓf the English WikipediÓt currently consists of over 2Óf990Óf000 Ótrticles Óts of August 12Óf 2009Óf Ótnd is considered to hÓtve similÓtr quÓtlity compÓtring to trÓtditionÓtl encyclopediÓts compiled by experts. (GilesÓf 2005) Due to these reÓtsonsÓf WikipediÓt hÓts become one of the lÓtrgest referenced tools.

Following the editoriÓtl Ótnd policy guidelinesÓf the Ma\tual of Styl\b (http://en.wikipediÓt.org/wiki/WikipediÓt:MÓtnuÓtl_of_Style)Óf most WikipediÓt Ótrticles hÓtve homogeneous text structureÓf metÓtdÓttÓtÓf Ótnd other consistent chÓtrÓtcteristics. The leÓtd sectionÓf Ótccording to the Ma\tual of Styl\bÓf gives the definition of the title Ótnd overviews of the Ótrticle.

WikipediÓt Ótrticles Ótlso contÓtin richÓf hÓtndcrÓtftedÓf structured metÓtdÓttÓt. These metÓtdÓttÓt includes informÓttion boxesÓf hÓtnd lÓtbeled cÓttegoriesÓf Ótnd the templÓtte thÓtt the Ótrticle is bÓtsed on. In WikipediÓtÓf Ót well developed Ótrticle mÓty be tÓtgged with up to Ót few dozens of cÓttegoriesÓf while Ótrticles in the eÓtrly stÓtge of development Ótre usuÓtlly tÓtgged with Ót couple of cÓttegoriesÓf or even no cÓttegory Ótt Ótll. The entire WikipediÓt cÓttegory structure consists of more thÓtn 350Óf000 cÓttegoriesÓf some ÓtppeÓtr in mÓtny ÓtrticlesÓf while mÓtny ÓtppeÓtr in only Ót hÓtndful of Ótrticles. These cÓttegories Ótre Ót mixed bÓtg of subject ÓtreÓtsÓf ÓtttributesÓf hypernymsÓf Ótnd editoriÓtl notes.

InternÓtl linkingÓf Ót phrÓtse in one entry linking to Ótnother entry in WikipediÓtÓf is Ótlso one of the most importÓtnt Ótnd unique feÓttures of WikipediÓt setting it ÓtpÓtrt from trÓtditionÓtl offline encyclopediÓts. The Ótrticle body usuÓtlly contÓtins dense internÓtl links ÓtnnotÓtted by volunteer editors. These internÓtl links provide the reÓtders with Ót simple wÓty to Ótccess importÓtnt relevÓtnt topics in WikipediÓt. Following the guidelines in the Ma\tual of Styl\bÓf only importÓtnt Ótnd closely relÓtted keywords Ótre selected Ótnd linked.

In WikipediÓtÓf every Ótrticles hÓts Ót unique Ótnd cÓtse sensitive titleÓf which is Ótlso used Óts in the lÓtst pÓtrt of its URL. When title conflict ÓtrisesÓf Ót pÓtrenthetic explÓtnÓttion is Ótppended to the conflicting titles rendering them unÓtmbiguousÓf Ótnd thÓtt will Ótlso trigger the creÓttion of Ót disambiguous pag\b (see http://en.wikipediÓt.org/wiki/WikipediÓt:DisÓtmbiguÓttion) thÓtt lists links to eÓtch of the conflicting titles with Ót short description. EÓtch of these Ótrticles hÓts its own unique titleÓf such Óts Satur\tÓf Satur\t (myt\fology)Óf Satur\t (magazi\t\b)Óf Ótnd Satur\t (microproc\bssor). sections.title: 2.2 Wo\fdNet\t
paragraphs: WordNet is Ót lexicÓtl semÓtntic dÓttÓtbÓtse for the content words in EnglishÓf initiÓtlly to support psycho-linguistic reseÓtrchÓf but increÓtsingly being used in nÓtturÓtl lÓtnguÓtge processingÓf informÓttion retrievÓtlÓf Ótnd ÓtrtificiÓtl intelligence reseÓtrch Ótnd ÓtpplicÓttions. The development of 74   WordNet begÓtn in 1985 Ótt Princeton UniversityÓf Ótnd mÓtny freely-downloÓtdÓtble versions of the dÓttÓtbÓtse hÓtve been releÓtsed under Ót BSD style license. WordNet groups nounsÓf verbsÓf ÓtdjectivesÓf Ótnd Ótdverbs into sets of synonyms cÓtlled synsetsÓf Ótnd provides glosses with definitions Ótnd exÓtmples. Every synset contÓtins Ót group of synonymous words or phrÓtses with different senses of Ót word Ótre in different synsets. For Ótmbiguous wordsÓf WordNet provides indicÓttion of how often Ót word ÓtppeÓtrs in Ót specific sense (synset) with the estimÓtted frequency count bÓtsed on Ót semÓtnticÓtlly tÓtgged corpus (i.e.Óf SEMÓbOR).

Unlike other dictionÓtriesÓf WordNet records vÓtrious semÓtntic relÓttions between synsets. In the lÓttest Version 3.0Óf the dÓttÓtbÓtse contÓtins extensively Ót totÓtl of 207Óf000 word-sense semÓtntic relÓttions between 150Óf000 words orgÓtnized in over 115Óf000 synsets. For exÓtmpleÓf the synset of {good, rig\ft, rip\b} is defined Óts most suitabl\b or rig\ft for a particular purpos\b Ótnd exemplified with three sentences: a good tim\b to pla\tt tomato\bs; t\f\b rig\ft tim\b to act; t\f\b tim\b is rip\b for gr\bat sociological c\fa\tg\bs). The semÓtntic relÓttions connecting synsets include (1) nominÓtl relÓttions: \fyp\br\tyms, \fypo\tyms, coordi\tat\b t\brms, \folo\tym, m\bro\tym, \fyp\br\tym for \tou\ts (2) verbÓtl relÓttions: \fyp\br\tym, tropo\tym, \b\ttailm\b\tt, coordi\tat\b t\brms (3) ÓtdjectivÓtl relÓttions: r\blat\bd \tou\ts, similar to, participl\b of v\brbÓf Ótnd (4) ÓtdverbiÓtl relÓttions: root adj\bctiv\bs. There Ótre Ótlso relÓttions connecting Ót specific word/phrÓtse in Ót synsetÓf relÓttions including a\tto\tyms Ótnd morp\fological d\brivativ\bs. These relÓttions Ótre extensively exploited in mÓtny word sense disÓtmbiguÓttion study Ótnd informÓttion retrievÓtl reseÓtrch.

With the \fyp\br\tymy relÓttionsÓf one cÓtn derive Ót hierÓtrchicÓtl semÓtntic clÓtssificÓttion of entities or Ótctions. AdditionÓtllyÓf WordNet Ótlso ÓtllocÓttes the synsets into lexicogrÓtpher filesÓf Ótlso known Óts lexicÓtl files or sup\brs\b\ts\bsÓf for division of work Ótmong lexicogrÓtphers. With lexicÓtl file informÓttionÓf one cÓtn derive Ót flÓtt semÓtntic clÓtssificÓttionÓf which in some situÓttion is more convenient to use. HoweverÓf it is not ÓtlwÓtys eÓtsy to clÓtssify Ót nÓtmed entity into one of the 26 nominÓtl lexicogrÓtpher files becÓtuse of the systemÓttic Ótmbiguity between LOÓbATION Ótnd OBJEÓbT (e.g.Óf islÓtnd)Óf GROUP Ótnd ARTIFAÓbT (e.g.Óf bÓtnk)Óf ANIMAL Ótnd FOOD (e.g.Óf fish)Óf just to nÓtme Ót few. In this pÓtperÓf we propose to clÓtssify WikipediÓt nÓtmed entities into WordNet lexicogrÓtpher files cÓttegories. Since NEs concentrÓtte in 9 clÓtssesÓf we ignore other 17 clÓtsses for simplicity. Supersense tÓtgging of WikipediÓt title is Ót preliminÓtry step for providing more specific semÓtntic linkÓtge between WikipediÓt Ótnd WordNet.

paragraphs: Mining semÓtntic knowledge from WikipediÓt is Ótn increÓtsingly Ótctive ÓtreÓt of reseÓtrch. WikipediÓt represents Ót gold mine of informÓttionÓf ÓtttrÓtcting Ót growing community of reseÓtrchers to tÓtp into this hugeÓf constÓtntly evolving repository of concepts Ótnd relÓttions in order to Ótpply to mÓtny interesting tÓtsks. RecentlyÓf works involve mining meÓtning from WikipediÓt hÓts been summÓtrized in MedelyÓtn et Ótl. (2009)Óf Ót survey pÓtper thÓtt provides Ótn in-depth description of the creÓttion process Ótnd textuÓtl structure of WikipediÓt pÓtgesÓf Ótnd review diverse effort thÓtt exploits WikipediÓt in mÓtny reseÓtrch ÓtreÓts: word sense disÓtmbiguÓttion (MihÓtlceÓt Ótnd ÓbsomÓtiÓf 2007; Ruiz-ÓbÓtsÓtdo et Ótl.Óf 2005; Wu Ótnd WeldÓf 2007)Óf bilinguÓtl lexicogrÓtphy (ErdmÓtnn et Ótl.Óf 2008; Tyers Ótnd PienÓtÓtrÓf 2008)Óf multilinguÓtl informÓttion retrievÓtl (PotthÓtst et Ótl.Óf 2008)Óf informÓttion extrÓtction Ótnd question Ótnswering (BÓtnko et Ótl.Óf 2007; TorÓtl Ótnd MuñozÓf 2007; Ferrández et Ótl.Óf 2007)Óf nÓtmed entities recognition (Bunescu Ótnd PÓtşcÓtÓf 2006; ÓbimiÓtno Ótnd VolkerÓf 2005; DÓtkkÓt Ótnd ÓbucerzÓtnÓf 2007)Óf Ótnd ontology construction (Auer et Ótl. 2007; Ponzetto Ótnd StrubeÓf 2007; SuchÓtnek et Ótl.Óf 2007).

In our work we Ótddress Ót specific knowledge mining problem of identifying Ótnd cÓttegorizing nÓtmed entities thÓtt ÓtppeÓtr Óts the titles in WikipediÓt (e.g.Óf identifying Ótnd cÓttegorizing Jo\f\t Updik\b Ótnd T\brrorist Óts nÓtmed entities of the types PERSON Ótnd ÓbOMMUNIÓbATION).

In the work on mining meÓtning from WikipediÓtÓf the most closely relÓtted body of reseÓtrch to our work focuses on word sense disÓtmbiguÓttion of WikipediÓt titlesÓf words Ótnd phrÓtses. 75   MihÓtlceÓt (2007) considers the sÓtme title (e.g.Óf bar) with different pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttions (e.g.Óf bar (\bstablis\fm\b\tt) Ótnd bar (cou\tt\br)) Óts sense inventory. Using WikipediÓt titles Óts sense inventory hÓts the ÓtdvÓtntÓtge of hÓtving ÓtvÓtilÓtble the running text with hyperlinks to these titles Óts the trÓtining dÓttÓt for WSD. More recentlyÓf MihÓtlceÓt Ótnd ÓbsomÓti (2007) introduce the Wikify! system for identifying keywords Ótnd hyper-linking them to relevÓtnt WikipediÓt entriesÓf bÓtsed on ÓtutomÓttic keyword extrÓtction Ótnd word sense disÓtmbiguÓttion techniques. Their proposed methods rely on two chÓtrÓtcteristics of WikipediÓtÓf the pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttions (for disÓtmbiguÓttion) Ótnd the internÓtl link structure. SimilÓtrlyÓf we use high-frequency pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttions to generÓtte titles/entries for certÓtin semÓtntic clÓtsses in WordNet Óts the trÓtining dÓttÓt for broÓtd sense clÓtssificÓttion of titles (with or without Ót pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttion).

In effort to utilize the informÓttion provided in WikipediÓt cÓttegoriesÓf SuchÓtnek et Ótl. (2007) developed the YAGO ontology which contÓtins links from WikipediÓt cÓttegories to WordNet sensesÓf thereby resolving the Ótmbiguities thÓtt exist in cÓttegory terms (e.g.Óf Capitals i\t Asia is relÓtted to capital cityÓf while V\b\ttur\b Capital is relÓtted to fu\td). Although YAGO only covered Ótbout 50% of Ótll WikipediÓt cÓttegoriesÓf these cÓttegories include substÓtntiÓtl pÓtrt of WikipediÓt Ótrticles (over 90%).

In Ót study more closely relÓtted to our workÓf ÓbiÓtrÓtmitÓt Ótnd Johnson (2003) Ótlso proposed Ót method for ÓtutomÓtticÓtlly expÓtnding WordNet by supersense tÓtgging out of vocÓtbulÓtry words/phrÓtses in Ót corpus. In contrÓtstÓf we focus on supersense tÓtgging WikipediÓt titles. By exploiting chÓtrÓtcteristics in WikipediÓtÓf our ÓtpproÓtch is Ótble to Ótchieve high ÓtccurÓtcy.

paragraphs: We propose two ÓtpproÓtches for generÓtting trÓtining dÓttÓtÓf one fully ÓtutomÓttic Ótnd one requires minimÓtl hÓtnd-lÓtbeling. paragraphs: The body of Ótn WikipediÓt Ótrticle contÓtins rich informÓttion helpful for semÓtntic clÓtssificÓttion of title. MoreoverÓf entries in WikipediÓt cÓtn virtuÓtlly be creÓtted by Ótnyone on the Web. New entries Ótre sometimes creÓtted by new volunteers less fÓtmiliÓtr with WikipediÓt thÓtn experienced editors. sections.title: 6 Conclusion\t
paragraphs: In summÓtryÓf we hÓtve presented Ót novel method for leÓtrning to clÓtssify nÓtmed entities into broÓtd semÓtntic cÓttegories. The method involves generÓtting trÓtining dÓttÓt by lÓtbeling high-frequency pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttionsÓf extrÓtcting lexicÓtlÓf conceptuÓtlÓf Ótnd metÓtdÓttÓt feÓttures to trÓtin Ót stÓttisticÓtl clÓtssifier. We hÓtve implemented Ótnd thoroughly evÓtluÓtted the method Óts Ótpplied to WikipediÓt Ótnd WordNet. The experimentÓtl results show thÓtt the method effectively exploit the richÓf consistentÓf Ótnd indicÓttive feÓttures in WikipediÓt pÓtges to clÓtssify titles Ótnd extend WordNet’s coverÓtge on nÓtmed entities.

MÓtny Ótvenues present themselves for future reseÓtrch Ótnd improvement of our system. For exÓtmpleÓf existing methods for pronoun resolution could be implemented to improve the quÓtlity of pronominÓtl feÓtture. NÓtturÓtl lÓtnguÓtge pÓtrsing techniques could be used to identify genus terms more precisely. AdditionÓtl pÓtrentheticÓtl explÓtnÓttions could be lÓtbeled to increÓtse the Ótmount of trÓtining dÓttÓt Ótnd support more semÓtntic cÓttegories. Effort could be mÓtde to bÓtlÓtnce the distribution of the trÓtining dÓttÓt Ótmong semÓtntic cÓttegories. AdditionÓtllyÓf Ótn interesting direction to explore is clÓtssifying titles into more specific cÓttegoriesÓf thereby linking them to direct hypernyms in WordNet Ótnd estÓtblishing “hÓts instÓtnce” relÓttions. For instÓtnceÓf it would be useful for some ÓtpplicÓttions to clÓtssify C\bli\t\b Dio\t Óts Ót SINGER. Yet Ótnother direction of reseÓtrch would be clÓtssifying OOV common nounsÓf especiÓtlly in Ót specific domÓtin. For exÓtmpleÓf it would be interesting to clÓtssify terminology (e.g.Óf the environmentÓtl protection termÓf \bcological footpri\tt in WikipediÓt) broÓtdly Óts Ótn ATTRIBUTEÓf or perhÓtps even more specificÓtlly Óts the direct hypernym of WordNet word sense (i.e.Óf footpri\tt#\t#3). 80
